value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">31</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The great house that <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hlat" key="Latimer, Hugh">Latimer</rs> 
            <choice>
              <sic>delpored</sic>
              <corr>deplored</corr>
            </choice> becomes solid and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">entire in the pages of Lady <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-aclif" key="Clifford, Ann">Anne Cliffords</rs> diary.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add hand="ms" place="above">From the first she is aware of her rights of a noble.</add> She is aware from her first youth of her rights as a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">land owner. She has a profound sense of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the rights of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>possesor</sic>
              <corr>possessor</corr>
            </choice>. The body is visible to her.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add hand="ms" place="above">what she [illeg.], the [illeg.]<!-- come back to this --></add>She is for ever rebuilding castles,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">acquiring land, asserting her rights to property,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">claiming diamond buttons, making 
            <choice>
              <sic>inventroies</sic>
              <corr>inventories</corr>
            </choice> of her 
            <choice>
              <sic>possesin</sic>
              <corr>possessions</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as if to 
            <choice>
              <sic>soldify</sic>
              <corr>solidify</corr>
            </choice> them further. <add hand="ms" place="above">Family love is in part the desire to maintain her [honour?]</add> She has asense of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">family who will 
            <choice>
              <sic>imherit</sic>
              <corr>inherit</corr>
            </choice> her possessions.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">She sends for her 
            <choice>
              <sic>grandcholdren</sic>
              <corr>grandchildren</corr>
            </choice> in order that 
            <choice>
              <sic>ghey</sic>
              <corr>they</corr>
            </choice> may</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">taste the delight of 
            <choice>
              <sic>posseson</sic>
              <corr>possession</corr>
            </choice> and so refresh her own satis</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">faction. The living body is robed in black and yellow</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">taffeta. Clothes are so 
            <choice>
              <sic>imp rtant</sic>
              <corr>important</corr>
            </choice> that they become things</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to be handed on. The living body is robed in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">black and yellow taffeta. The dead body is sealed in lead</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to preserve its flesh from 
            <choice>
              <sic>d cay</sic>
              <corr>decay</corr>
            </choice>. The The sense of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">body permeates her pages; <del hand="ms">whether alive or dead.</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The human soul seems to become more expressive when its</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>carcase</sic>
              <corr>carcass</corr>
            </choice> flashed in the public eye. All movements of the human</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">body, from place to place, are attended with great effort;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and become 
            <choice>
              <sic>specatacular</sic>
              <corr>spectacular</corr>
            </choice>. Six bay horses drag the coach;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>Th</sic>
              <corr>The</corr>
            </choice> coach is lined with green cloth, and laced</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with green and black silk lace. 
            <choice>
              <sic>Crwods</sic>
              <corr>Crowds</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice>
              <sic>attned</sic>
              <corr>attend</corr>
            </choice> her.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">She is for ever asserting her identity,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with 
            <choice>
              <sic>inittails</sic>
              <corr>initials</corr>
            </choice> carved in stone even over 
            <choice>
              <sic>farm hous</sic>
              <corr>farmhouse</corr>
            </choice> walls.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">This is her property; this land is hers by right.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Fxmxmxmxmxmmxmx 
            <choice>
              <sic>Certian</sic>
              <corr>Certain</corr>
            </choice> flesh and blood--txmxmmxmxmxmx</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" hand="ms" place="margin">
            <l>of what was</l>
            <l>due to her </l>
            <l>birth ––</l>
            <l>then, as she grows older,</l>
            <l>she fights, even in the</l>
            <l>Kings presence, for her</l>
            <l>land</l>
          </add>
